page.title: 08TRADE - BARGOED AND DISTRICT
page.content: GILFACH SHOPPING - Gilfach's shopping street is dominated by small units converted from 'front rooms' of houses. There are 16 units, 50% of which are food units. There are at present 9 empty premises. These are indicative of the fall in use of local shops, probably due to the poor walk- ways and the volume of through traffic, and of course, the proximity of Bargoed. ABERBARGOED SHOPPING - Aberbargoed has quite a range of typical small units. 74% of the villagers use one shop at least once a week. However, the bulk of food purchases are made out of the village (48% in Bargoed and 39% elsewhere; e.g. Carrefour, Asda). 77% of Aberbargoed people make the journey to Bargoed on Market Day (Thursday) on a regular basis.
